p: CT in centrilobular-emphysema shows small, well-defined or poorly defined areas of low attenuation surrounded by normal lung; centrilobular pulmonary arteries or arterioles mark the center of each lobule. The low-attenuation areas may range from 1-3 mm. Small airway disease is often a component of both emphysema-predominant disease and airway-predominant disease involving larger airways. Isolated small airway disease can also occur as a primary expression of COPD [ 16].
